item.title: Cheddar Popcorn
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Instructions Place oil in a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Place 3 popcorn kernels in the pot. Cover Wait for all 3 kernels to pop. Add remaining popcorn kernels. Cover the pot with a lid and cook until two seconds go by and kernels are no longer popping, about 3 minutes....
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • ¼ cup vegetable oil
  • ¾ cup popcorn
  • 2 tablespoons Cheddar cheese powder

Instructions

Place oil in a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Place 3 popcorn kernels in the pot. Cover

Wait for all 3 kernels to pop. Add remaining popcorn kernels. Cover the pot with a lid and cook until two seconds go by and kernels are no longer popping, about 3 minutes.

Transfer popped corn to a large bowl. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon Cheddar cheese powder over popcorn; toss. Sprinkle remaining 1 tablespoon cheese powder over popcorn; toss again. Serve immediately.

Published by

– Dulan –

For chef’s review:

item.title: Baked Potato Chips
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Instructions Preheat the oven to 400 degrees (200 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with paper towels Using a mandoline, slice potatoes on the thinnest setting, about 1/8-inch thick. Place slices on the paper towel-lined baking sheets Place a layer of paper towels over the potato slices. Let stand 5 minutes. Press...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 1 pound Yukon gold potatoes
  • 2 teaspoons olive oil
  • 1/2 teaspoon sea salt

Instructions

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees (200 degrees C). Line 2 baking sheets with paper towels Using a mandoline, slice potatoes on the thinnest setting, about 1/8-inch thick. Place slices on the paper towel-lined baking sheets Place a layer of paper towels over the potato slices. Let stand 5 minutes. Press down on paper towels to remove excess moisture. Discard paper towels. Place potato slices in a large bowl. Add oil and salt. Gently stir to combine. Line baking sheets with parchment paper. Divide potato slices between baking sheets in an even layer. Remove chips from the oven and cool for 5 minutes; they will become more crisp as they cool.

Published by

– Dilshan –

item.title: Cranberry and Oat balls
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Instructions Place the date in a food processor and process until a smooth paste forms. Transfer to a medium bowl. Add the oats, cranberries, pepitas and almond butter and stir until well combined. Line a baking tray with baking paper. Use wet hands to roll tablespoonfuls of the date mixture into balls. Place on the prepared tray. Place in the...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 10 fresh dates, seeded, coarsely chopped
  • 1 cup (90g) rolled oats
  • ¼ cup (35g) reduced-sugar dried cranberries
  • ¼ cup (50g) pepitas (pumpkin seeds), toasted
  • 2 tbsp almond butter

Instructions

Place the date in a food processor and process until a smooth paste forms. Transfer to a medium bowl. Add the oats, cranberries, pepitas and almond butter and stir until well combined.

Line a baking tray with baking paper. Use wet hands to roll tablespoonfuls of the date mixture into balls. Place on the prepared tray. Place in the fridge for 1 hour to set. Store in an airtight container for up to 2 hours.

Published by

– Rashmie –

For chef’s review:

item.title: Rhubarb Bran Muffins
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Instructions Combine oat bran and boiling water in a bowl. Set aside for 20 mins or until water is absorbed. Preheat oven to 200C or 180C fan. Line 10 holes of a 1/3-cup capacity muffin pan with paper cases. Place rhubarb, 1 tablespoon brown sugar and extra boiling water in a bowl. Toss to combine. Whisk remaining...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 1 cup oat bran
  • ¾ cup boiling water, plus 1 tbsp extra
  • 6 stalks rhubarb, trimmed, chopped
  • 2/3 cup Coles brand brown sugar
  • 1 egg, lightly beaten
  • 2 tbsp vegetable oil
  • 1 cup self-raising flour, sifted
  • ¼ cup milk

Instructions

Combine oat bran and boiling water in a bowl. Set aside for 20 mins or until water is absorbed. Preheat oven to 200C or 180C fan. Line 10 holes of a 1/3-cup capacity muffin pan with paper cases. Place rhubarb, 1 tablespoon brown sugar and extra boiling water in a bowl. Toss to combine. Whisk remaining brown sugar, egg and oil in a large bowl. Stir in bran mixture until smooth. Add flour, milk and half the chopped rhubarb. Stir until just combined. Spoon into paper cases. Scatter over remaining rhubarb and bake for 25-30 mins until muffins spring back when lightly touched. Cool on a wire rack.

Published by

– Sayumi –
